intro: Narcissus haworthii, commonly known as the Haworth's daffodil, is a species of flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces one or two flowers per stem. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
